threats.title: Session Hijacking via Stolen JWT
threats.description: An attacker could intercept or steal a valid JSON Web Token (JWT) or session cookie and impersonate a legitimate user, gaining access to the API server.

threats.title: Tampering with Job Payloads in Redis Queue
threats.description: Malicious actors could modify or inject job payloads in the Redis queue before the worker processes them, potentially causing the worker to send unintended requests to external LLM providers.

threats.title: Lack of Audit Logging for User Actions
threats.description: Without comprehensive audit logs, users can repudiate actions they performed, making it difficult to trace malicious or accidental changes.

threats.title: Unencrypted Sensitive Data in PostgreSQL
threats.description: Storing API keys, user credentials, or LLM responses in plain text could lead to data exposure if the database is compromised.

threats.title: Denial of Service via Queue Overload
threats.description: An attacker could flood the Redis queue with excessive job requests, exhausting worker resources and causing service disruption.

threats.title: Privilege Escalation through Misconfigured Roles
threats.description: If role-based access control is incorrectly implemented, a normal user might gain access to administrative endpoints or sensitive data.
